page.title: 15Biddestone Clubs,etc
page.content: THE ROYAL BRITISH LEGION An organisation formed after the 1914/18 war to attend to the needs of ex-servoce men and women, particularly those who were disabled. The village branch has been in existence since the 1950's when it divided the Castle Combe and Yatton Keynell branch into two. Committee meetings are held monthly at the White Horse and all members are welcome to attend. THE 1ST BIDDESTONE BROWNIE GUIDES The junior section of the Girl Guides Association. The Biddestone Pack has been warranted since 1947 and has operated continuously since that date. It meets in the garden of Elm Lodge every Monday to learn useful skills and to have fun. Any girl from the age of seven to eleven is welcome.
